thread.title: Openings in major Bay Area theaters, Oct. 25-31
thread.title_full: Openings in major Bay Area theaters, Oct. 25-31 - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: Openings in major Bay Area theaters, Oct. 25-31
text:
New onstage 
Once: SHN brings back the touring company of the popular Broadway musical, about a Dublin street musician and his perhaps new love, for a one-week reprise. Opens Tuesday, Oct. 27. Through Nov. 1. Orpheum Theatre, 1192 Market St., S.F. (888) 746-1799. www.shnsf.com . 
The Pipeline Project: Anna Deavere Smith performs the latest iteration of her docudrama project about the school-to-prison cycle that affects so many black, Latino and American Indian youths. Friday, Oct. 30. Bing Concert Hall, Stanford University. (650) 724-2464. www.live.stanford.edu . 
Previews
My Ma√±ana Comes: Marin Theatre Company introduces playwright Elizabeth Irwin with the regional premiere of her play about four busboys, two undocumented, at an upscale Manhattan restaurant, facing harsh pay cuts, poverty and disunity. Previews begin Thursday, Oct. 29. Opens Nov. 3. Through Nov. 22. Marin Theatre Company, 397 Miller Ave., Mill Valley. (415) 388-5208. www.marintheatre.org .
